is not the problem with planets like this, when thay go behind the gas giant the tempricher drops to below freezing. its hard for life to evolve on a plant that goes from tropical to antarctic in les then a month?.
Please, no pandora. A wholly original system inspired by ours but significantly different would be much more interesting. No planets with life, other than maybe europa-like planets.

Space isn\'t a 2D plane guys, a planet in orbit around a gas giant may have sufficient inclination as to almost never come into its shadow. It\'s also worth noting that the orbital period of Callisto, which is sometimes cited as a target for human exploration of the Jovian system for the lesser radiation it receives, has an orbital period of 16 days, little of which is spent in Jupiter\'s shadow. Saying that a planet would become uninhabitable for passing behind its parent gas giant is like saying Earth should be uninhabitable because nighttime exists.

And come up with something more original than Pandora, please.

What about a lifeless system But signs of a interstellar ancient civilization from millions of yrs ago

You all know it was already said how Kerbol\'s system is going to be made.

The main idea is that the general layout will be the same (4 rocky planets, 4 gas giants with moons), but the appearance and content of all these planets is up in the air.

So bringing up concepts for bodies that we don\'t even have in a system that was already said to be close to the solar system is just silly.
